wasm64.name: crt-static
wasm64.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

wasm64.name: multivalue
wasm64.explanation: Enable multivalue blocks, instructions, and functions.

s390x.name: crt-static
s390x.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

s390x.name: bear-enhancement
s390x.explanation: Assume that the BEAR-enhancement facility is installed.

s390x.name: deflate-conversion
s390x.explanation: Assume that the deflate-conversion facility is installed.

s390x.name: dfp-packed-conversion
s390x.explanation: Assume that the DFP packed-conversion facility is installed.

s390x.name: dfp-zoned-conversion
s390x.explanation: Assume that the DFP zoned-conversion facility is installed.

s390x.name: distinct-ops
s390x.explanation: Assume that the distinct-operands facility is installed.

s390x.name: enhanced-dat-2
s390x.explanation: Assume that the enhanced-DAT facility 2 is installed.

s390x.name: enhanced-sort
s390x.explanation: Assume that the enhanced-sort facility is installed.

s390x.name: execution-hint
s390x.explanation: Assume that the execution-hint facility is installed.

s390x.name: fast-serialization
s390x.explanation: Assume that the fast-serialization facility is installed.

s390x.name: fp-extension
s390x.explanation: Assume that the floating-point extension facility is installed.

s390x.name: guarded-storage
s390x.explanation: Assume that the guarded-storage facility is installed.

s390x.name: high-word
s390x.explanation: Assume that the high-word facility is installed.

s390x.name: insert-reference-bits-multiple
s390x.explanation: Assume that the insert-reference-bits-multiple facility is installed.

s390x.name: interlocked-access1
s390x.explanation: Assume that interlocked-access facility 1 is installed.

s390x.name: load-and-trap
s390x.explanation: Assume that the load-and-trap facility is installed.

s390x.name: load-and-zero-rightmost-byte
s390x.explanation: Assume that the load-and-zero-rightmost-byte facility is installed.

s390x.name: load-store-on-cond
s390x.explanation: Assume that the load/store-on-condition facility is installed.

s390x.name: load-store-on-cond-2
s390x.explanation: Assume that the load/store-on-condition facility 2 is installed.

s390x.name: message-security-assist-extension3
s390x.explanation: Assume that the message-security-assist extension facility 3 is installed.

s390x.name: message-security-assist-extension4
s390x.explanation: Assume that the message-security-assist extension facility 4 is installed.

s390x.name: message-security-assist-extension5
s390x.explanation: Assume that the message-security-assist extension facility 5 is installed.

s390x.name: message-security-assist-extension7
s390x.explanation: Assume that the message-security-assist extension facility 7 is installed.

s390x.name: message-security-assist-extension8
s390x.explanation: Assume that the message-security-assist extension facility 8 is installed.

s390x.name: message-security-assist-extension9
s390x.explanation: Assume that the message-security-assist extension facility 9 is installed.

s390x.name: miscellaneous-extensions
s390x.explanation: Assume that the miscellaneous-extensions facility is installed.

s390x.name: miscellaneous-extensions-2
s390x.explanation: Assume that the miscellaneous-extensions facility 2 is installed.

s390x.name: miscellaneous-extensions-3
s390x.explanation: Assume that the miscellaneous-extensions facility 3 is installed.

s390x.name: nnp-assist
s390x.explanation: Assume that the NNP-assist facility is installed.

s390x.name: population-count
s390x.explanation: Assume that the population-count facility is installed.

s390x.name: processor-activity-instrumentation
s390x.explanation: Assume that the processor-activity-instrumentation facility is installed.

s390x.name: processor-assist
s390x.explanation: Assume that the processor-assist facility is installed.

s390x.name: reset-dat-protection
s390x.explanation: Assume that the reset-DAT-protection facility is installed.

s390x.name: reset-reference-bits-multiple
s390x.explanation: Assume that the reset-reference-bits-multiple facility is installed.

s390x.name: soft-float
s390x.explanation: Use software emulation for floating point.

s390x.name: transactional-execution
s390x.explanation: Assume that the transactional-execution facility is installed.

s390x.name: vector
s390x.explanation: Assume that the vectory facility is installed.

s390x.name: vector-enhancements-1
s390x.explanation: Assume that the vector enhancements facility 1 is installed.

s390x.name: vector-enhancements-2
s390x.explanation: Assume that the vector enhancements facility 2 is installed.

s390x.name: vector-packed-decimal
s390x.explanation: Assume that the vector packed decimal facility is installed.

s390x.name: vector-packed-decimal-enhancement
s390x.explanation: Assume that the vector packed decimal enhancement facility is installed.

s390x.name: vector-packed-decimal-enhancement-2
s390x.explanation: Assume that the vector packed decimal enhancement facility 2 is installed.

x86.name: avx512bw
x86.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Byte and Word Instructions.

x86.name: avx512dq
x86.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Doubleword and Quadword Instructions.

x86.name: avx512er
x86.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Exponential and Reciprocal Instructions.

x86.name: avx512vaes
x86.explanation: Promote selected AES instructions to AVX512/AVX registers.

x86.name: avx512vbmi
x86.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Vector Byte Manipulation Instructions.

x86.name: avx512vbmi2
x86.explanation: Enable AVX-512 further Vector Byte Manipulation Instructions.

x86.name: avx512vnni
x86.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Vector Neural Network Instructions.

x86.name: cmpxchg16b
x86.explanation: 64-bit with cmpxchg16b (this is true for most x86-64 chips, but not the first AMD chips).

x86.name: crt-static
x86.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

x86.name: branchfusion
x86.explanation: CMP/TEST can be fused with conditional branches.

x86.name: crc32
x86.explanation: Enable SSE 4.2 CRC32 instruction (used when SSE4.2 is supported but function is GPR only).

x86.name: false-deps-getmant
x86.explanation: VGETMANTSS/SD/SH and VGETMANDPS/PD(memory version) has a false dependency on dest register.

x86.name: false-deps-lzcnt-tzcnt
x86.explanation: LZCNT/TZCNT have a false dependency on dest register.

x86.name: false-deps-mulc
x86.explanation: VF[C]MULCPH/SH has a false dependency on dest register.

x86.name: false-deps-mullq
x86.explanation: VPMULLQ has a false dependency on dest register.

x86.name: false-deps-perm
x86.explanation: VPERMD/Q/PS/PD has a false dependency on dest register.

x86.name: false-deps-popcnt
x86.explanation: POPCNT has a false dependency on dest register.

x86.name: false-deps-range
x86.explanation: VRANGEPD/PS/SD/SS has a false dependency on dest register.

x86.name: fast-11bytenop
x86.explanation: Target can quickly decode up to 11 byte NOPs.

x86.name: fast-15bytenop
x86.explanation: Target can quickly decode up to 15 byte NOPs.

x86.name: fast-7bytenop
x86.explanation: Target can quickly decode up to 7 byte NOPs.

x86.name: fast-bextr
x86.explanation: Indicates that the BEXTR instruction is implemented as a single uop with good throughput.

x86.name: fast-gather
x86.explanation: Indicates if gather is reasonably fast (this is true for Skylake client and all AVX-512 CPUs).

x86.name: fast-hops
x86.explanation: Prefer horizontal vector math instructions (haddp, phsub, etc.) over normal vector instructions with shuffles.

x86.name: fast-lzcnt
x86.explanation: LZCNT instructions are as fast as most simple integer ops.

x86.name: fast-movbe
x86.explanation: Prefer a movbe over a single-use load + bswap / single-use bswap + store.

x86.name: fast-scalar-shift-masks
x86.explanation: Prefer a left/right scalar logical shift pair over a shift+and pair.

x86.name: fast-shld-rotate
x86.explanation: SHLD can be used as a faster rotate.

x86.name: fast-variable-crosslane-shuffle
x86.explanation: Cross-lane shuffles with variable masks are fast.

x86.name: fast-variable-perlane-shuffle
x86.explanation: Per-lane shuffles with variable masks are fast.

x86.name: fast-vector-shift-masks
x86.explanation: Prefer a left/right vector logical shift pair over a shift+and pair.

x86.name: fsrm
x86.explanation: REP MOVSB of short lengths is faster.

x86.name: harden-sls-ijmp
x86.explanation: Harden against straight line speculation across indirect JMP instructions..

x86.name: harden-sls-ret
x86.explanation: Harden against straight line speculation across RET instructions..

x86.name: idivl-to-divb
x86.explanation: Use 8-bit divide for positive values less than 256.

x86.name: idivq-to-divl
x86.explanation: Use 32-bit divide for positive values less than 2^32.

x86.name: lea-sp
x86.explanation: Use LEA for adjusting the stack pointer (this is an optimization for Intel Atom processors).

x86.name: lea-uses-ag
x86.explanation: LEA instruction needs inputs at AG stage.

x86.name: lvi-cfi
x86.explanation: Prevent indirect calls/branches from using a memory operand, and precede all indirect calls/branches from a register with an LFENCE instruction to serialize control flow. Also decompose RET instructions into a POP+LFENCE+JMP sequence..

x86.name: lvi-load-hardening
x86.explanation: Insert LFENCE instructions to prevent data speculatively injected into loads from being used maliciously..

x86.name: macrofusion
x86.explanation: Various instructions can be fused with conditional branches.

x86.name: pad-short-functions
x86.explanation: Pad short functions (to prevent a stall when returning too early).

x86.name: prefer-mask-registers
x86.explanation: Prefer AVX512 mask registers over PTEST/MOVMSK.

x86.name: prefetchwt1
x86.explanation: Prefetch with Intent to Write and T1 Hint.

x86.name: retpoline
x86.explanation: Remove speculation of indirect branches from the generated code, either by avoiding them entirely or lowering them with a speculation blocking construct.

x86.name: retpoline-external-thunk
x86.explanation: When lowering an indirect call or branch using a `retpoline`, rely on the specified user provided thunk rather than emitting one ourselves. Only has effect when combined with some other retpoline feature.

x86.name: retpoline-indirect-branches
x86.explanation: Remove speculation of indirect branches from the generated code.

x86.name: retpoline-indirect-calls
x86.explanation: Remove speculation of indirect calls from the generated code.

x86.name: sahf
x86.explanation: Support LAHF and SAHF instructions in 64-bit mode.

x86.name: sbb-dep-breaking
x86.explanation: SBB with same register has no source dependency.

x86.name: seses
x86.explanation: Prevent speculative execution side channel timing attacks by inserting a speculation barrier before memory reads, memory writes, and conditional branches. Implies LVI Control Flow integrity..

x86.name: slow-3ops-lea
x86.explanation: LEA instruction with 3 ops or certain registers is slow.

x86.name: slow-incdec
x86.explanation: INC and DEC instructions are slower than ADD and SUB.

x86.name: slow-lea
x86.explanation: LEA instruction with certain arguments is slow.

x86.name: slow-pmulld
x86.explanation: PMULLD instruction is slow (compared to PMULLW/PMULHW and PMULUDQ).

x86.name: slow-two-mem-ops
x86.explanation: Two memory operand instructions are slow.

x86.name: sse-unaligned-mem
x86.explanation: Allow unaligned memory operands with SSE instructions (this may require setting a configuration bit in the processor).

x86.name: tagged-globals
x86.explanation: Use an instruction sequence for taking the address of a global that allows a memory tag in the upper address bits..

x86.name: use-glm-div-sqrt-costs
x86.explanation: Use Goldmont specific floating point div/sqrt costs.

sparc64.name: crt-static
sparc64.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

sparc64.name: deprecated-v8
sparc64.explanation: Enable deprecated V8 instructions in V9 mode.

sparc64.name: detectroundchange
sparc64.explanation: LEON3 erratum detection: Detects any rounding mode change request: use only the round-to-nearest rounding mode.

sparc64.name: fixallfdivsqrt
sparc64.explanation: LEON erratum fix: Fix FDIVS/FDIVD/FSQRTS/FSQRTD instructions with NOPs and floating-point store.

sparc64.name: hard-quad-float
sparc64.explanation: Enable quad-word floating point instructions.

sparc64.name: hasleoncasa
sparc64.explanation: Enable CASA instruction for LEON3 and LEON4 processors.

sparc64.name: hasumacsmac
sparc64.explanation: Enable UMAC and SMAC for LEON3 and LEON4 processors.

sparc64.name: insertnopload
sparc64.explanation: LEON3 erratum fix: Insert a NOP instruction after every single-cycle load instruction when the next instruction is another load/store instruction.

sparc64.name: leon
sparc64.explanation: Enable LEON extensions.

sparc64.name: leoncyclecounter
sparc64.explanation: Use the Leon cycle counter register.

sparc64.name: leonpwrpsr
sparc64.explanation: Enable the PWRPSR instruction.

sparc64.name: no-fmuls
sparc64.explanation: Disable the fmuls instruction..

sparc64.name: no-fsmuld
sparc64.explanation: Disable the fsmuld instruction..

sparc64.name: popc
sparc64.explanation: Use the popc (population count) instruction.

sparc64.name: soft-float
sparc64.explanation: Use software emulation for floating point.

sparc64.name: soft-mul-div
sparc64.explanation: Use software emulation for integer multiply and divide.

sparc64.name: v9
sparc64.explanation: Enable SPARC-V9 instructions.

sparc64.name: vis
sparc64.explanation: Enable UltraSPARC Visual Instruction Set extensions.

sparc64.name: vis2
sparc64.explanation: Enable Visual Instruction Set extensions II.

sparc64.name: vis3
sparc64.explanation: Enable Visual Instruction Set extensions III.

powerpc64.name: crt-static
powerpc64.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

powerpc64.name: allow-unaligned-fp-access
powerpc64.explanation: CPU does not trap on unaligned FP access.

powerpc64.name: float128
powerpc64.explanation: Enable the __float128 data type for IEEE-754R Binary128..

powerpc64.name: fpcvt
powerpc64.explanation: Enable fc[ft]* (unsigned and single-precision) and lfiwzx instructions.

powerpc64.name: fuse-add-logical
powerpc64.explanation: Target supports Add with Logical Operations fusion.

powerpc64.name: fuse-arith-add
powerpc64.explanation: Target supports Arithmetic Operations with Add fusion.

powerpc64.name: fuse-back2back
powerpc64.explanation: Target supports general back to back fusion.

powerpc64.name: fuse-logical-add
powerpc64.explanation: Target supports Logical with Add Operations fusion.

powerpc64.name: fuse-zeromove
powerpc64.explanation: Target supports move to SPR with branch fusion.

powerpc64.name: modern-aix-as
powerpc64.explanation: AIX system assembler is modern enough to support new mnes.

powerpc64.name: msync
powerpc64.explanation: Has only the msync instruction instead of sync.

powerpc64.name: predictable-select-expensive
powerpc64.explanation: Prefer likely predicted branches over selects.

mips.name: crt-static
mips.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

mips.name: long-calls
mips.explanation: Disable use of the jal instruction.

mips.name: mips3_32
mips.explanation: Subset of MIPS-III that is also in MIPS32 [highly experimental].

mips.name: mips3_32r2
mips.explanation: Subset of MIPS-III that is also in MIPS32r2 [highly experimental].

mips.name: mips4_32
mips.explanation: Subset of MIPS-IV that is also in MIPS32 [highly experimental].

mips.name: mips4_32r2
mips.explanation: Subset of MIPS-IV that is also in MIPS32r2 [highly experimental].

mips.name: mips5_32r2
mips.explanation: Subset of MIPS-V that is also in MIPS32r2 [highly experimental].

mips.name: soft-float
mips.explanation: Does not support floating point instructions.

mips.name: use-indirect-jump-hazard
mips.explanation: Use indirect jump guards to prevent certain speculation based attacks.

mips.name: use-tcc-in-div
mips.explanation: Force the assembler to use trapping.

hexagon.name: crt-static
hexagon.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

hexagon.name: hvx-ieee-fp
hexagon.explanation: Hexagon HVX IEEE floating point instructions.

hexagon.name: noreturn-stack-elim
hexagon.explanation: Eliminate stack allocation in a noreturn function when possible.

hexagon.name: small-data
hexagon.explanation: Allow GP-relative addressing of global variables.

m68k.name: crt-static
m68k.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

mips64.name: crt-static
mips64.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

mips64.name: long-calls
mips64.explanation: Disable use of the jal instruction.

mips64.name: mips3_32
mips64.explanation: Subset of MIPS-III that is also in MIPS32 [highly experimental].

mips64.name: mips3_32r2
mips64.explanation: Subset of MIPS-III that is also in MIPS32r2 [highly experimental].

mips64.name: mips4_32
mips64.explanation: Subset of MIPS-IV that is also in MIPS32 [highly experimental].

mips64.name: mips4_32r2
mips64.explanation: Subset of MIPS-IV that is also in MIPS32r2 [highly experimental].

mips64.name: mips5_32r2
mips64.explanation: Subset of MIPS-V that is also in MIPS32r2 [highly experimental].

mips64.name: soft-float
mips64.explanation: Does not support floating point instructions.

mips64.name: use-indirect-jump-hazard
mips64.explanation: Use indirect jump guards to prevent certain speculation based attacks.

mips64.name: use-tcc-in-div
mips64.explanation: Force the assembler to use trapping.

msp430.name: crt-static
msp430.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

avr.name: crt-static
avr.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

avr.name: addsubiw
avr.explanation: Enable 16-bit register-immediate addition and subtraction instructions.

avr.name: avr0
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr0 family.

avr.name: avr1
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr1 family.

avr.name: avr2
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr2 family.

avr.name: avr25
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr25 family.

avr.name: avr3
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr3 family.

avr.name: avr31
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr31 family.

avr.name: avr35
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr35 family.

avr.name: avr4
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr4 family.

avr.name: avr5
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr5 family.

avr.name: avr51
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr51 family.

avr.name: avr6
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avr6 family.

avr.name: avrtiny
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the avrtiny family.

avr.name: break
avr.explanation: The device supports the `BREAK` debugging instruction.

avr.name: des
avr.explanation: The device supports the `DES k` encryption instruction.

avr.name: eijmpcall
avr.explanation: The device supports the `EIJMP`/`EICALL` instructions.

avr.name: elpm
avr.explanation: The device supports the ELPM instruction.

avr.name: elpmx
avr.explanation: The device supports the `ELPM Rd, Z[+]` instructions.

avr.name: ijmpcall
avr.explanation: The device supports `IJMP`/`ICALL`instructions.

avr.name: jmpcall
avr.explanation: The device supports the `JMP` and `CALL` instructions.

avr.name: lpm
avr.explanation: The device supports the `LPM` instruction.

avr.name: lpmx
avr.explanation: The device supports the `LPM Rd, Z[+]` instruction.

avr.name: memmappedregs
avr.explanation: The device has CPU registers mapped in data address space.

avr.name: movw
avr.explanation: The device supports the 16-bit MOVW instruction.

avr.name: mul
avr.explanation: The device supports the multiplication instructions.

avr.name: rmw
avr.explanation: The device supports the read-write-modify instructions: XCH, LAS, LAC, LAT.

avr.name: smallstack
avr.explanation: The device has an 8-bit stack pointer.

avr.name: special
avr.explanation: Enable use of the entire instruction set

avr.name: spm
avr.explanation: The device supports the `SPM` instruction.

avr.name: spmx
avr.explanation: The device supports the `SPM Z+` instruction.

avr.name: sram
avr.explanation: The device has random access memory.

avr.name: tinyencoding
avr.explanation: The device has Tiny core specific instruction encodings.

avr.name: xmega
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the xmega family.

avr.name: xmega3
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the xmega3 family.

avr.name: xmegau
avr.explanation: The device is a part of the xmegau family.

aarch64.name: ras
aarch64.explanation: Enable ARMv8 Reliability, Availability and Serviceability Extensions.

aarch64.name: lse
aarch64.explanation: Enable ARMv8.1 Large System Extension (LSE) atomic instructions.

aarch64.name: rdm
aarch64.explanation: Enable ARMv8.1 Rounding Double Multiply Add/Subtract instructions.

aarch64.name: rcpc2
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.4-A RCPC instructions with Immediate Offsets.

aarch64.name: dit
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.4-A Data Independent Timing instructions.

aarch64.name: ssbs
aarch64.explanation: Enable Speculative Store Bypass Safe bit.

aarch64.name: dpb
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.2 data Cache Clean to Point of Persistence.

aarch64.name: dpb2
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.5 Cache Clean to Point of Deep Persistence.

aarch64.name: frintts
aarch64.explanation: Enable FRInt[32|64][Z|X] instructions that round a floating-point number to an integer (in FP format) forcing it to fit into a 32- or 64-bit int.

aarch64.name: jsconv
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.3-A JavaScript FP conversion instructions.

aarch64.name: fcma
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.3-A Floating-point complex number support.

aarch64.name: pan
aarch64.explanation: Enables ARM v8.1 Privileged Access-Never extension.

aarch64.name: lor
aarch64.explanation: Enables ARM v8.1 Limited Ordering Regions extension.

aarch64.name: vh
aarch64.explanation: Enables ARM v8.1 Virtual Host extension.

aarch64.name: pmuv3
aarch64.explanation: Enable ARMv8 PMUv3 Performance Monitors extension.

aarch64.name: crt-static
aarch64.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

aarch64.name: alternate-sextload-cvt-f32-pattern
aarch64.explanation: Use alternative pattern for sextload convert to f32.

aarch64.name: altnzcv
aarch64.explanation: Enable alternative NZCV format for floating point comparisons.

aarch64.name: amvs
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.6-A Activity Monitors Virtualization support.

aarch64.name: apple-a7
aarch64.explanation: Apple A7 (the CPU formerly known as Cyclone).

aarch64.name: apple-a7-sysreg
aarch64.explanation: Apple A7 (the CPU formerly known as Cyclone).

aarch64.name: ascend-store-address
aarch64.explanation: Schedule vector stores by ascending address.

aarch64.name: balance-fp-ops
aarch64.explanation: balance mix of odd and even D-registers for fp multiply(-accumulate) ops.

aarch64.name: ccidx
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.3-A Extend of the CCSIDR number of sets.

aarch64.name: custom-cheap-as-move
aarch64.explanation: Use custom handling of cheap instructions.

aarch64.name: el2vmsa
aarch64.explanation: Enable Exception Level 2 Virtual Memory System Architecture.

aarch64.name: exynos-cheap-as-move
aarch64.explanation: Use Exynos specific handling of cheap instructions.

aarch64.name: fgt
aarch64.explanation: Enable fine grained virtualization traps extension.

aarch64.name: force-32bit-jump-tables
aarch64.explanation: Force jump table entries to be 32-bits wide except at MinSize.

aarch64.name: fuse-address
aarch64.explanation: CPU fuses address generation and memory operations.

aarch64.name: fuse-arith-logic
aarch64.explanation: CPU fuses arithmetic and logic operations.

aarch64.name: fuse-crypto-eor
aarch64.explanation: CPU fuses AES/PMULL and EOR operations.

aarch64.name: harden-sls-blr
aarch64.explanation: Harden against straight line speculation across BLR instructions.

aarch64.name: harden-sls-nocomdat
aarch64.explanation: Generate thunk code for SLS mitigation in the normal text section.

aarch64.name: harden-sls-retbr
aarch64.explanation: Harden against straight line speculation across RET and BR instructions.

aarch64.name: hbc
aarch64.explanation: Enable Armv8.8-A Hinted Conditional Branches Extension.

aarch64.name: ldapr
aarch64.explanation: Use LDAPR to lower atomic loads; experimental until we have more testing/a formal correctness proof.

aarch64.name: lse2
aarch64.explanation: Enable ARMv8.4 Large System Extension 2 (LSE2) atomicity rules.

aarch64.name: lsl-fast
aarch64.explanation: CPU has a fastpath logical shift of up to 3 places.

aarch64.name: mops
aarch64.explanation: Enable Armv8.8-A memcpy and memset acceleration instructions.

aarch64.name: mpam
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.4-A Memory system Partitioning and Monitoring extension.

aarch64.name: no-bti-at-return-twice
aarch64.explanation: Don't place a BTI instruction after a return-twice.

aarch64.name: no-neg-immediates
aarch64.explanation: Convert immediates and instructions to their negated or complemented equivalent when the immediate does not fit in the encoding..

aarch64.name: no-zcz-fp
aarch64.explanation: Has no zero-cycle zeroing instructions for FP registers.

aarch64.name: outline-atomics
aarch64.explanation: Enable out of line atomics to support LSE instructions.

aarch64.name: pan-rwv
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.2 PAN s1e1R and s1e1W Variants.

aarch64.name: predictable-select-expensive
aarch64.explanation: Prefer likely predicted branches over selects.

aarch64.name: predres
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.5a execution and data prediction invalidation instructions.

aarch64.name: reserve-x1
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X1, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x10
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X10, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x11
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X11, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x12
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X12, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x13
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X13, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x14
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X14, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x15
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X15, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x18
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X18, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x2
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X2, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x20
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X20, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x21
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X21, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x22
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X22, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x23
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X23, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x24
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X24, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x25
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X25, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x26
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X26, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x27
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X27, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x28
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X28, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x3
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X3, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x30
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X30, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x4
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X4, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x5
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X5, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x6
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X6, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x7
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X7, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: reserve-x9
aarch64.explanation: Reserve X9, making it unavailable as a GPR.

aarch64.name: sel2
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.4-A Secure Exception Level 2 extension.

aarch64.name: slow-paired-128
aarch64.explanation: Paired 128 bit loads and stores are slow.

aarch64.name: slow-strqro-store
aarch64.explanation: STR of Q register with register offset is slow.

aarch64.name: sme-f64
aarch64.explanation: Enable Scalable Matrix Extension (SME) F64F64 instructions.

aarch64.name: sme-i64
aarch64.explanation: Enable Scalable Matrix Extension (SME) I16I64 instructions.

aarch64.name: spe-eef
aarch64.explanation: Enable extra register in the Statistical Profiling Extension.

aarch64.name: tagged-globals
aarch64.explanation: Use an instruction sequence for taking the address of a global that allows a memory tag in the upper address bits.

aarch64.name: tlb-rmi
aarch64.explanation: Enable v8.4-A TLB Range and Maintenance Instructions.

aarch64.name: tpidr-el1
aarch64.explanation: Permit use of TPIDR_EL1 for the TLS base.

aarch64.name: tpidr-el2
aarch64.explanation: Permit use of TPIDR_EL2 for the TLS base.

aarch64.name: tpidr-el3
aarch64.explanation: Permit use of TPIDR_EL3 for the TLS base.

aarch64.name: use-experimental-zeroing-pseudos
aarch64.explanation: Hint to the compiler that the MOVPRFX instruction is merged with destructive operations.

aarch64.name: use-reciprocal-square-root
aarch64.explanation: Use the reciprocal square root approximation.

aarch64.name: wfxt
aarch64.explanation: Enable Armv8.7-A WFET and WFIT instruction.

aarch64.name: zcz-fp-workaround
aarch64.explanation: The zero-cycle floating-point zeroing instruction has a bug.

aarch64.name: zcz-gp
aarch64.explanation: Has zero-cycle zeroing instructions for generic registers.

nvptx64.name: crt-static
nvptx64.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

riscv32.name: crt-static
riscv32.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

riscv32.name: unaligned-scalar-mem
riscv32.explanation: Has reasonably performant unaligned scalar loads and stores.

riscv32.name: zve32f
riscv32.explanation: 'Zve32f' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 32 EEW and F extension).

riscv32.name: zve32x
riscv32.explanation: 'Zve32x' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 32 EEW).

riscv32.name: zve64d
riscv32.explanation: 'Zve64d' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 64 EEW, F and D extension).

riscv32.name: zve64f
riscv32.explanation: 'Zve64f' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 64 EEW and F extension).

riscv32.name: zve64x
riscv32.explanation: 'Zve64x' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 64 EEW).

powerpc.name: crt-static
powerpc.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

powerpc.name: allow-unaligned-fp-access
powerpc.explanation: CPU does not trap on unaligned FP access.

powerpc.name: float128
powerpc.explanation: Enable the __float128 data type for IEEE-754R Binary128..

powerpc.name: fpcvt
powerpc.explanation: Enable fc[ft]* (unsigned and single-precision) and lfiwzx instructions.

powerpc.name: fuse-add-logical
powerpc.explanation: Target supports Add with Logical Operations fusion.

powerpc.name: fuse-arith-add
powerpc.explanation: Target supports Arithmetic Operations with Add fusion.

powerpc.name: fuse-back2back
powerpc.explanation: Target supports general back to back fusion.

powerpc.name: fuse-logical-add
powerpc.explanation: Target supports Logical with Add Operations fusion.

powerpc.name: fuse-zeromove
powerpc.explanation: Target supports move to SPR with branch fusion.

powerpc.name: modern-aix-as
powerpc.explanation: AIX system assembler is modern enough to support new mnes.

powerpc.name: msync
powerpc.explanation: Has only the msync instruction instead of sync.

powerpc.name: predictable-select-expensive
powerpc.explanation: Prefer likely predicted branches over selects.

x86_64.name: avx512bw
x86_64.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Byte and Word Instructions.

x86_64.name: avx512dq
x86_64.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Doubleword and Quadword Instructions.

x86_64.name: avx512er
x86_64.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Exponential and Reciprocal Instructions.

x86_64.name: avx512vaes
x86_64.explanation: Promote selected AES instructions to AVX512/AVX registers.

x86_64.name: avx512vbmi
x86_64.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Vector Byte Manipulation Instructions.

x86_64.name: avx512vbmi2
x86_64.explanation: Enable AVX-512 further Vector Byte Manipulation Instructions.

x86_64.name: avx512vnni
x86_64.explanation: Enable AVX-512 Vector Neural Network Instructions.

x86_64.name: cmpxchg16b
x86_64.explanation: 64-bit with cmpxchg16b (this is true for most x86-64 chips, but not the first AMD chips).

x86_64.name: crt-static
x86_64.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

x86_64.name: branchfusion
x86_64.explanation: CMP/TEST can be fused with conditional branches.

x86_64.name: crc32
x86_64.explanation: Enable SSE 4.2 CRC32 instruction (used when SSE4.2 is supported but function is GPR only).

x86_64.name: false-deps-getmant
x86_64.explanation: VGETMANTSS/SD/SH and VGETMANDPS/PD(memory version) has a false dependency on dest register.

x86_64.name: false-deps-lzcnt-tzcnt
x86_64.explanation: LZCNT/TZCNT have a false dependency on dest register.

x86_64.name: false-deps-mulc
x86_64.explanation: VF[C]MULCPH/SH has a false dependency on dest register.

x86_64.name: false-deps-mullq
x86_64.explanation: VPMULLQ has a false dependency on dest register.

x86_64.name: false-deps-perm
x86_64.explanation: VPERMD/Q/PS/PD has a false dependency on dest register.

x86_64.name: false-deps-popcnt
x86_64.explanation: POPCNT has a false dependency on dest register.

x86_64.name: false-deps-range
x86_64.explanation: VRANGEPD/PS/SD/SS has a false dependency on dest register.

x86_64.name: fast-11bytenop
x86_64.explanation: Target can quickly decode up to 11 byte NOPs.

x86_64.name: fast-15bytenop
x86_64.explanation: Target can quickly decode up to 15 byte NOPs.

x86_64.name: fast-7bytenop
x86_64.explanation: Target can quickly decode up to 7 byte NOPs.

x86_64.name: fast-bextr
x86_64.explanation: Indicates that the BEXTR instruction is implemented as a single uop with good throughput.

x86_64.name: fast-gather
x86_64.explanation: Indicates if gather is reasonably fast (this is true for Skylake client and all AVX-512 CPUs).

x86_64.name: fast-hops
x86_64.explanation: Prefer horizontal vector math instructions (haddp, phsub, etc.) over normal vector instructions with shuffles.

x86_64.name: fast-lzcnt
x86_64.explanation: LZCNT instructions are as fast as most simple integer ops.

x86_64.name: fast-movbe
x86_64.explanation: Prefer a movbe over a single-use load + bswap / single-use bswap + store.

x86_64.name: fast-scalar-shift-masks
x86_64.explanation: Prefer a left/right scalar logical shift pair over a shift+and pair.

x86_64.name: fast-shld-rotate
x86_64.explanation: SHLD can be used as a faster rotate.

x86_64.name: fast-variable-crosslane-shuffle
x86_64.explanation: Cross-lane shuffles with variable masks are fast.

x86_64.name: fast-variable-perlane-shuffle
x86_64.explanation: Per-lane shuffles with variable masks are fast.

x86_64.name: fast-vector-shift-masks
x86_64.explanation: Prefer a left/right vector logical shift pair over a shift+and pair.

x86_64.name: fsrm
x86_64.explanation: REP MOVSB of short lengths is faster.

x86_64.name: harden-sls-ijmp
x86_64.explanation: Harden against straight line speculation across indirect JMP instructions..

x86_64.name: harden-sls-ret
x86_64.explanation: Harden against straight line speculation across RET instructions..

x86_64.name: idivl-to-divb
x86_64.explanation: Use 8-bit divide for positive values less than 256.

x86_64.name: idivq-to-divl
x86_64.explanation: Use 32-bit divide for positive values less than 2^32.

x86_64.name: lea-sp
x86_64.explanation: Use LEA for adjusting the stack pointer (this is an optimization for Intel Atom processors).

x86_64.name: lea-uses-ag
x86_64.explanation: LEA instruction needs inputs at AG stage.

x86_64.name: lvi-cfi
x86_64.explanation: Prevent indirect calls/branches from using a memory operand, and precede all indirect calls/branches from a register with an LFENCE instruction to serialize control flow. Also decompose RET instructions into a POP+LFENCE+JMP sequence..

x86_64.name: lvi-load-hardening
x86_64.explanation: Insert LFENCE instructions to prevent data speculatively injected into loads from being used maliciously..

x86_64.name: macrofusion
x86_64.explanation: Various instructions can be fused with conditional branches.

x86_64.name: pad-short-functions
x86_64.explanation: Pad short functions (to prevent a stall when returning too early).

x86_64.name: prefer-mask-registers
x86_64.explanation: Prefer AVX512 mask registers over PTEST/MOVMSK.

x86_64.name: prefetchwt1
x86_64.explanation: Prefetch with Intent to Write and T1 Hint.

x86_64.name: retpoline
x86_64.explanation: Remove speculation of indirect branches from the generated code, either by avoiding them entirely or lowering them with a speculation blocking construct.

x86_64.name: retpoline-external-thunk
x86_64.explanation: When lowering an indirect call or branch using a `retpoline`, rely on the specified user provided thunk rather than emitting one ourselves. Only has effect when combined with some other retpoline feature.

x86_64.name: retpoline-indirect-branches
x86_64.explanation: Remove speculation of indirect branches from the generated code.

x86_64.name: retpoline-indirect-calls
x86_64.explanation: Remove speculation of indirect calls from the generated code.

x86_64.name: sahf
x86_64.explanation: Support LAHF and SAHF instructions in 64-bit mode.

x86_64.name: sbb-dep-breaking
x86_64.explanation: SBB with same register has no source dependency.

x86_64.name: seses
x86_64.explanation: Prevent speculative execution side channel timing attacks by inserting a speculation barrier before memory reads, memory writes, and conditional branches. Implies LVI Control Flow integrity..

x86_64.name: slow-3ops-lea
x86_64.explanation: LEA instruction with 3 ops or certain registers is slow.

x86_64.name: slow-incdec
x86_64.explanation: INC and DEC instructions are slower than ADD and SUB.

x86_64.name: slow-lea
x86_64.explanation: LEA instruction with certain arguments is slow.

x86_64.name: slow-pmulld
x86_64.explanation: PMULLD instruction is slow (compared to PMULLW/PMULHW and PMULUDQ).

x86_64.name: slow-two-mem-ops
x86_64.explanation: Two memory operand instructions are slow.

x86_64.name: sse-unaligned-mem
x86_64.explanation: Allow unaligned memory operands with SSE instructions (this may require setting a configuration bit in the processor).

x86_64.name: tagged-globals
x86_64.explanation: Use an instruction sequence for taking the address of a global that allows a memory tag in the upper address bits..

x86_64.name: use-glm-div-sqrt-costs
x86_64.explanation: Use Goldmont specific floating point div/sqrt costs.

wasm32.name: crt-static
wasm32.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

wasm32.name: multivalue
wasm32.explanation: Enable multivalue blocks, instructions, and functions.

riscv64.name: crt-static
riscv64.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

riscv64.name: unaligned-scalar-mem
riscv64.explanation: Has reasonably performant unaligned scalar loads and stores.

riscv64.name: zve32f
riscv64.explanation: 'Zve32f' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 32 EEW and F extension).

riscv64.name: zve32x
riscv64.explanation: 'Zve32x' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 32 EEW).

riscv64.name: zve64d
riscv64.explanation: 'Zve64d' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 64 EEW, F and D extension).

riscv64.name: zve64f
riscv64.explanation: 'Zve64f' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 64 EEW and F extension).

riscv64.name: zve64x
riscv64.explanation: 'Zve64x' (Vector Extensions for Embedded Processors with maximal 64 EEW).

sparc.name: crt-static
sparc.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

sparc.name: deprecated-v8
sparc.explanation: Enable deprecated V8 instructions in V9 mode.

sparc.name: detectroundchange
sparc.explanation: LEON3 erratum detection: Detects any rounding mode change request: use only the round-to-nearest rounding mode.

sparc.name: fixallfdivsqrt
sparc.explanation: LEON erratum fix: Fix FDIVS/FDIVD/FSQRTS/FSQRTD instructions with NOPs and floating-point store.

sparc.name: hard-quad-float
sparc.explanation: Enable quad-word floating point instructions.

sparc.name: hasleoncasa
sparc.explanation: Enable CASA instruction for LEON3 and LEON4 processors.

sparc.name: hasumacsmac
sparc.explanation: Enable UMAC and SMAC for LEON3 and LEON4 processors.

sparc.name: insertnopload
sparc.explanation: LEON3 erratum fix: Insert a NOP instruction after every single-cycle load instruction when the next instruction is another load/store instruction.

sparc.name: leon
sparc.explanation: Enable LEON extensions.

sparc.name: leoncyclecounter
sparc.explanation: Use the Leon cycle counter register.

sparc.name: leonpwrpsr
sparc.explanation: Enable the PWRPSR instruction.

sparc.name: no-fmuls
sparc.explanation: Disable the fmuls instruction..

sparc.name: no-fsmuld
sparc.explanation: Disable the fsmuld instruction..

sparc.name: popc
sparc.explanation: Use the popc (population count) instruction.

sparc.name: soft-float
sparc.explanation: Use software emulation for floating point.

sparc.name: soft-mul-div
sparc.explanation: Use software emulation for integer multiply and divide.

sparc.name: v9
sparc.explanation: Enable SPARC-V9 instructions.

sparc.name: vis
sparc.explanation: Enable UltraSPARC Visual Instruction Set extensions.

sparc.name: vis2
sparc.explanation: Enable Visual Instruction Set extensions II.

sparc.name: vis3
sparc.explanation: Enable Visual Instruction Set extensions III.

arm.name: dsp
arm.explanation: Supports DSP instructions in ARM and/or Thumb2.

arm.name: dotprod
arm.explanation: Enable support for dot product instructions.

arm.name: v5te
arm.explanation: Support ARM v5TE, v5TEj, and v5TExp instructions.

arm.name: crt-static
arm.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.

arm.name: 8msecext
arm.explanation: Enable support for ARMv8-M Security Extensions.

arm.name: aapcs-frame-chain
arm.explanation: Create an AAPCS compliant frame chain.

arm.name: aapcs-frame-chain-leaf
arm.explanation: Create an AAPCS compliant frame chain for leaf functions.

arm.name: atomics-32
arm.explanation: Assume that lock-free 32-bit atomics are available.

arm.name: avoid-movs-shop
arm.explanation: Avoid movs instructions with shifter operand.

arm.name: avoid-partial-cpsr
arm.explanation: Avoid CPSR partial update for OOO execution.

arm.name: cheap-predicable-cpsr
arm.explanation: Disable +1 predication cost for instructions updating CPSR.

arm.name: disable-postra-scheduler
arm.explanation: Don't schedule again after register allocation.

arm.name: execute-only
arm.explanation: Enable the generation of execute only code..

arm.name: fix-cmse-cve-2021-35465
arm.explanation: Mitigate against the cve-2021-35465 security vulnurability.

arm.name: fix-cortex-a57-aes-1742098
arm.explanation: Work around Cortex-A57 Erratum 1742098 / Cortex-A72 Erratum 1655431 (AES).

arm.name: fp-armv8d16
arm.explanation: Enable ARMv8 FP with only 16 d-registers.

arm.name: fp-armv8d16sp
arm.explanation: Enable ARMv8 FP with only 16 d-registers and no double precision.

arm.name: fp-armv8sp
arm.explanation: Enable ARMv8 FP with no double precision.

arm.name: fp16fml
arm.explanation: Enable full half-precision floating point fml instructions.

arm.name: fp64
arm.explanation: Floating point unit supports double precision.

arm.name: fpao
arm.explanation: Enable fast computation of positive address offsets.

arm.name: harden-sls-blr
arm.explanation: Harden against straight line speculation across indirect calls.

arm.name: harden-sls-nocomdat
arm.explanation: Generate thunk code for SLS mitigation in the normal text section.

arm.name: harden-sls-retbr
arm.explanation: Harden against straight line speculation across RETurn and BranchRegister instructions.

arm.name: hwdiv-arm
arm.explanation: Enable divide instructions in ARM mode.

arm.name: long-calls
arm.explanation: Generate calls via indirect call instructions.

arm.name: mve
arm.explanation: Support M-Class Vector Extension with integer ops.

arm.name: mve.fp
arm.explanation: Support M-Class Vector Extension with integer and floating ops.

arm.name: mve1beat
arm.explanation: Model MVE instructions as a 1 beat per tick architecture.

arm.name: mve2beat
arm.explanation: Model MVE instructions as a 2 beats per tick architecture.

arm.name: mve4beat
arm.explanation: Model MVE instructions as a 4 beats per tick architecture.

arm.name: neon-fpmovs
arm.explanation: Convert VMOVSR, VMOVRS, VMOVS to NEON.

arm.name: neonfp
arm.explanation: Use NEON for single precision FP.

arm.name: no-bti-at-return-twice
arm.explanation: Don't place a BTI instruction after a return-twice.

arm.name: no-movt
arm.explanation: Don't use movt/movw pairs for 32-bit imms.

arm.name: no-neg-immediates
arm.explanation: Convert immediates and instructions to their negated or complemented equivalent when the immediate does not fit in the encoding..

arm.name: noarm
arm.explanation: Does not support ARM mode execution.

arm.name: pacbti
arm.explanation: Enable Pointer Authentication and Branch Target Identification.

arm.name: perfmon
arm.explanation: Enable support for Performance Monitor extensions.

arm.name: ras
arm.explanation: Enable Reliability, Availability and Serviceability extensions.

arm.name: reserve-r9
arm.explanation: Reserve R9, making it unavailable as GPR.

arm.name: slow-load-D-subreg
arm.explanation: Loading into D subregs is slow.

arm.name: slow-odd-reg
arm.explanation: VLDM/VSTM starting with an odd register is slow.

arm.name: splat-vfp-neon
arm.explanation: Splat register from VFP to NEON.

arm.name: trustzone
arm.explanation: Enable support for TrustZone security extensions.

arm.name: vfp2sp
arm.explanation: Enable VFP2 instructions with no double precision.

arm.name: vfp3d16
arm.explanation: Enable VFP3 instructions with only 16 d-registers.

arm.name: vfp3d16sp
arm.explanation: Enable VFP3 instructions with only 16 d-registers and no double precision.

arm.name: vfp3sp
arm.explanation: Enable VFP3 instructions with no double precision.

arm.name: vfp4d16
arm.explanation: Enable VFP4 instructions with only 16 d-registers.

arm.name: vfp4d16sp
arm.explanation: Enable VFP4 instructions with only 16 d-registers and no double precision.

arm.name: vfp4sp
arm.explanation: Enable VFP4 instructions with no double precision.

arm.name: wide-stride-vfp
arm.explanation: Use a wide stride when allocating VFP registers.

bpf.name: crt-static
bpf.explanation: Enables C Run-time Libraries to be statically linked.
